metadata.feature_description: Integrate Disqus commenting system for post discussions

steps.expected: Connectors page loads with list of available connectors including Disqus
steps.actual: Connectors page loaded successfully showing Disqus connector with 'Connect' button indicating it is not yet configured

steps.action: Click Connect button for Disqus connector
steps.expected: Configuration form opens with required fields
steps.actual: Configuration form expanded showing 'Disqus shortname:' and 'API Key:' text fields with Cancel and Save buttons

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Comments Section Behavior Without Configuration

steps.action: Navigate to a published post detail page (News > Test Blog Post)
steps.expected: Post detail page loads showing post content; Disqus comments section should not appear when Disqus is not configured
steps.actual: Post detail page loaded successfully showing post title, date, content, author info, and social sharing buttons. No Disqus comments section is displayed, which is correct behavior per code review (ShowComments requires _disqusManager.HasBeenConfigured to be true)

observations: Disqus integration requires external Disqus account configuration with a valid 'shortname' and 'API Key' to function

Code review of Detail.ascx.cs (line 116-119) confirms ShowComments logic: comments only display when NOT in edit mode, AllowedComments is true, Post is Published, AND Disqus HasBeenConfigured returns true
The Disqus connector (Settings > Connectors > Disqus) is present and accessible but not configured in this test environment
Without valid Disqus credentials, full comments functionality (display comments, post new comment, reply, moderation, notifications) cannot be tested as these require an active Disqus account
Code in Detail.ascx (lines 76-106) shows Disqus embed script that would load comments via JavaScript when configured
The Publisher module correctly hides the comments section when Disqus is not configured, preventing broken embeds from appearing
